intro: Melampyrum australe, commonly known as the Australian touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Its small, bright yellow flowers are clustered in dense spikes, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Melampyrum australe is an important plant in ecological studies due to its role in soil stabilization and as a food source for certain insect species.
